page.title: 01THE SCENERY AROUND YANWORTH
page.content: This is{a very pretty area of the {Cotswolds} and is described in many guide books. Several{public footpaths conveniently cross this area and link the{famous Roman Villa near Chedworth with{Yanworth}and its{Norman church. From the high plateau there are {extensive views} of the intensive arable farming, the large area of deciduous woodland and the pretty valley of the Coln, starting on its journey to join the Thames. The narrow winding lanes descend between high banks and hedges through steep sided valleys leading to the Coln. The main settlement at{Yanworth}is sited on the south and sunny side of the plateau. With almost no modern buildings, virtually no commuters, no industrial development and no tourist facilities, {around Yanworth there is an unspoilt {rural but working Cotswold landscape.
